wikipedia_page.main: William Salmond (9 February 1835 – 6 March 1917) was a notable New Zealand presbyterian minister, university professor and writer. He was born in Edinburgh, Midlothian, Scotland in 1835. The geologist Robin Allan was his grandson.

response: * Major-General Sir William Salmond (British Army officer) (1840–1932), 19th century British Army officer
* William Salmond (Presbyterian minister) (1835–1917), New Zealand presbyterian minister, university professor and writer

Born in North Shields in 1868 the son of the Reverend Dr William Salmond he emigrated as a child with his family when his father was appointed the first Professor of Theology at the Theological Hall in Dunedin.Salmond, 2003, p.13 He attended Otago Boys' High School and was articled to R.A. Lawson. Through that association he met the artist George O'Brien in 1888 and left an impression of him.Entwisle, 1984, p.69. He went into practice on his own account but later formed a partnership with Lawson when the latter returned to Dunedin in 1900. The practice later became Salmond and Vanes.
Robin Sutcliffe Allan (7 September 1900 – 5 July 1966) was a New Zealand geologist and university professor. The university professor William Salmond was his grandfather.
